metadata.dc:author: Chacín-Bonilla, Leonor
metadata.dc:description: Until recently, only the bovine and human genotypes of Cryptosporidium parvum had been considered to infect man and to be potential pathogens. Lately, symptomatic infections with C. felis, C. meleagridis, and dog C. parvum-like genotype have been described in immunocompetent and immunosuppressed individuals. These findings suggest that zoonotic parasites could also play an important role in Public Health.
metadata.dc:title: Importancia de las diferentes especies y genotipos de Cryptosporidium en Salud Pública.
[Importance of the different species and genotypes of Cryptosporidium in public health].
